description: An alternate universe town based on 19th century feudal Japan during the Edo period. In this reality, the Straw Hat crew members live as regular citizens rather than pirates, with Luffy serving as a detective/secret policeman, Nami and Sanji running a restaurant, and Chopper working as the town doctor.

keyEvents.title: Cherry Blossom Festival Preparation
keyEvents.description: The townspeople of Grand Jipangu prepare for their annual hanami festival centered around the thousand-year-old sakura tree.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the cultural importance of the festival and sets up the episode's central conflict.

keyEvents.title: The Cherry Tree is Returned
keyEvents.description: After defeating the thieves, the Straw Hats return the stolen cherry tree to Grand Jipangu, allowing all villagers including Ninjin to see it.
keyEvents.significance: Resolves the conflict and restores the cultural treasure to the community.

statusHistory.reason: Fictional alternate universe setting appearing only in Boss Luffy Historical Special episodes

description: A park in Grand Jipangu that houses the legendary thousand-year-old cherry blossom tree. This location serves as the central gathering place for the annual hanami festival where townspeople celebrate the blooming sakura.

keyEvents.title: The Thousand-Year Sakura Tree
keyEvents.description: The park's ancient cherry blossom tree is introduced as a cherished cultural symbol where the community gathers annually for hanami celebrations.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the importance of the tree that will be stolen, creating the episode's central conflict.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of the Missing Tree
keyEvents.description: Townspeople arrive at the park for the festival only to discover the thousand-year-old cherry tree has been stolen overnight.
keyEvents.significance: The crime scene that launches the investigation and drives the plot forward.

statusHistory.reason: Central location for the episode's events

description: A restaurant in Grand Jipangu co-owned and operated by Nami (called 'Onami' in this setting) and Sanji. This establishment serves as a gathering place for the townspeople and where Usopp shares his theory about Luffy being the cherry tree thief.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Shares His Theory
keyEvents.description: Usopp visits the Pinwheel cafeteria to tell Nami and Sanji his theory that Luffy stole the cherry tree to help Ninjin.
keyEvents.significance: The location where false accusations against Luffy are discussed, creating dramatic tension.

statusHistory.reason: Recurring location in Boss Luffy Historical Special episodes

description: The residence where sick Ninjin stays during the episode. From his window, he can eventually see the recovered thousand-year cherry blossom tree, which miraculously cures his illness.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Brings Cherry Blossom Branch
keyEvents.description: Luffy visits Ninjin's house and shows the sick boy a cherry blossom branch to cheer him up, which Usopp and Sanji misinterpret as evidence of theft.
keyEvents.significance: Location of the false evidence that temporarily implicates Luffy.

keyEvents.title: Ninjin's Miraculous Recovery
keyEvents.description: From his house window, Ninjin sees the recovered cherry tree and is miraculously cured by the sight of the beautiful sakura.
keyEvents.significance: The heartwarming conclusion where Ninjin's wish is fulfilled and his health is restored.

statusHistory.reason: Key location for episode's emotional resolution

name.japanese: グランド・ジパング港

description: The harbor area of Grand Jipangu where Foxy's pirate ship is docked with the stolen cherry blossom tree. This becomes the battleground where Luffy, Sanji, Usopp, and Zoro confront and defeat Buggy and Foxy.

keyEvents.title: Robin Discovers the Stolen Tree
keyEvents.description: Robin spots the thousand-year cherry tree on Foxy's pirate ship docked in the harbor and alerts the other Straw Hats.
keyEvents.significance: Discovery of the crime scene and the true culprits, clearing Luffy's name.

keyEvents.title: Buggy vs Foxy Battle
keyEvents.description: At the harbor, Buggy and Foxy's partnership dissolves into combat when Foxy's betrayal is revealed.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the villains turn on each other before the heroes arrive.

keyEvents.title: Final Battle at the Harbor
keyEvents.description: Luffy defeats both Foxy and Buggy at the harbor, with Buggy's scattered body parts flying across the water.
keyEvents.significance: Climactic battle location where the heroes triumph and recover the stolen tree.

statusHistory.reason: Battle location and site of the stolen tree's discovery
